sentence: The war cry for justice was all over - Much to the chagrin of the authorities.
Scots_Gaelic: Bha a 'chogaidh a' caoineadh a 'chogaidh a-null - mòran ri Cangrin nan ùghdarrasan.
backtrans: The war crying the War crying the War 'many as Canngrid's Cornwall were the Cornwanner of the authorities.

sentence: The regime's decision adumbrates the underlying agenda.
Scots_Gaelic: Tha co-dhùnadh an rèim a 'toirt a-mach a' chlàr-obrach bunaiteach.
backtrans: The decision of the regime produces the basic agenda.

sentence: The community was anxious over the passing of the much needed reforms.
Scots_Gaelic: Bha a 'choimhearsnachd draghail mu dheidhinn an ath-leasachaidhean fada a tha a dhìth.
backtrans: The local community was concerned about their missing reforms.

sentence: The think tank  published a paper outlining their apology of capital punishment.
Scots_Gaelic: Dh'fhoillsich an Tanca Smacsa pàipear a 'toirt cunntas air leisgeul peanas calpa.
backtrans: The Plockton Tank announced an account of capital punishment.

sentence: Aught was left of the petition's validity
Scots_Gaelic: Bha an toireadh air fhàgail de dhligheachd an athchuinge
backtrans: Would reserve the right of petition

sentence: The President exhorted his ministers to buckle up as key opposition support for his economic plan was about to buckle.
Scots_Gaelic: Dhaingnich an Ceann-suidhe air a mhinistearan a bhith a 'bucallachadh mar phrìomh thaic dùbhlannach airson a' Phlana Eaconamach aice a bhith a 'buckle.
backtrans: President confirmed its consignmental support for her economic plan being buckle.

sentence: The voters were chuffed to see the bill passed.
Scots_Gaelic: Chaidh an luchd-bhòtaidh a chguffed a bhith a 'faicinn a' bhile seachad.
backtrans: The voters were buguffed to see the Bill.

sentence: The lawyer's discursive narration swayed the jury.
Scots_Gaelic: Rinn aithris an neach-lagha an diùraidh.
backtrans: The lawyer's report made the jury.

sentence: The EU block opposed an eventual imposition of anti-dumping measures.
Scots_Gaelic: Bha am bloc an EU an aghaidh dealbhadh taisbeanaidh de cheumannan an aghaidh dumpadh.
backtrans: The EU block was against exhibition planning of measures of dumped face.

sentence: A fulsome eulogy was delivered by the sly counsel.
Scots_Gaelic: Chaidh h-umhail a chaidh a lìbhrigeadh leis a 'chomhairle Slyome a lìbhrigeadh.
backtrans: Universally delivered by the SKYOME Council has been delivered.

sentence: The gig-economy agency decided to garnish the refunds!
Scots_Gaelic: Cho-dhùin a 'Bhuidheann Eaconamaidh Gig na dh' ath-dhìoladh a ghearradh!
backtrans: The Gig economy group decided to cut a refund!

sentence: Members of the anti-theocratic revolutionary movement overthrew the peers in power!
Scots_Gaelic: Chuir buill den gluasad troma-cheilteach an-aghaidh theorratach às deidh a 'cho-aoisean ann an cumhachd!
backtrans: Members of the comedy repressed shift against the tense after the peer in power!

sentence: The traitors disappointingly decided to fight with the colonialists.
Scots_Gaelic: Cho-dhùin na riarachdan briseadh-dùil sabaid leis na coloninistearan.
backtrans: The disappeared decided to fight with the Colonsists.
